data.title: century Barcelona by Picasso, Pablo; Museo Picasso
data.meta_description: Picasso & Els 4 Gats by Teresa Ocana, Maria and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Very Good. Book is in Used-VeryGood condition. Pages and cover are clean and intact. Used items may not include supplementary materials such as CDs or access codes. May show signs of minor shelf wear and contain very limited notes and highlighting. 4.

Hardcover. Condition: used. First Edition. Els 4 Gats was a celebrated tavern that served as the main meeting place for avant-garde artists in turn-of-the-century Barcelona. It was the venue for the young Picasso's first one-man exhibition. This exhibition, comprising primarily portraits of his friends and acquaintances, launched Picasso's career. Picasso continued to frequent Els 4 Gats until the tavern closed in 1903. This text publishes Picasso's work from the Els 4 Gats exhibition, along with other paintings and drawings from this pivotal and unfamiliar period in his early artistic life. It served as a catalogue for an exhibition at the Pablo Museum in Barcelona (Autumn/Winter 1995/1996).

Condition: Sehr gut. 322 S. Umschlag leicht berieben, sonst gutes Exemplar. - CONTENTS:PICASSO AND THE QUATRE GATS - THE KEY TO MODERNITY Maria Teresa Ocaña -- PICASSO AND ELS QUATRE GATS Francesc Fontbona -- CASAS AND PICASSO Cristina Mendoza -- MODERNIST PICASSO Malen Gual -- THE ROAD TO THE 1900 WORLD EXPOSITION IN PARIS Lluis Bagunyâ -- CHRONICLE FROM PARIS Maria Teresa Ocaña -- PICASSO'S PORTRAITS OF HIS BARCELONA FRIENDS Marilyn McCully -- ELS QUATRE GATS SEEN THROUGH THE METAMORPHOSIS OF THE BLUE PERIOD Claustre Rafart i Planas -- ART ACTIVITY AT ELS QUATRE GATS Mercè Donate -- FROM ELS QUATRE GATS TO CAU FERRÂT. THE ARTISTIC LINKS -- BETWEEN SANTIAGO RUSINOL AND PICASSO (1896-1903) Vinyet Panyella -- THE END OF THE QUATRE GATS Josep Palau i Fahre. ISBN 9780821223390 Sprache: Deutsch Gewicht in Gramm: 1550 Mit zahlr. auch farb. Abb. Originalleinen mit Schutzumschlag.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition. "Els 4 Gats was a celebrated tavern that served as the main meeting place for avant-garde artists in turn-of-the-century Barcelona. It was the venue for the young Picasso's first one-man exhibition. This exhibition, comprising primarily portraits of his friends and acquaintances, launched Picasso's career. Picasso continued to frequent Els 4 Gats until the tavern closed in 1903. This text publishes Picasso's work from the Els 4 Gats exhibition, along with other paintings and drawings from this pivotal and unfamiliar period in his early artistic life." Quarto. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket - as new, still sealed in the original shrink wrap.

Ocana, Maria Teresa. PICASSO and Els 4 Gats: The Early Years in Turn-of-the-Century Barcelona. 324 pp., 222 color plates and 12 b&w illustrations. 4to, cloth. Boston, Little Brown, 1996. The Els 4 Gats was a well-known bar that was much frequented by avant-garde artists in turn-of-the-century Barcelona, and was the venue for Pable Picasso's first one-man show in 1900. This book served as the catalogue to an exhibition at the Pable Picasso Museum in 1995, and reproduces the works displayed at the Els 4 Gats, including rarely seen early paintings, drawings, pastels, and illustrated letters, many published for the first time. The author is the director of the pable Picasso Museum in Barcelona and has written a book on Picasso's landscapes, published last year. Announced for September.
